body:
Hey @jedwards1211! We really appreciate you taking the time to report an issue. The  collaborators on this project attempt to help as many people as  possible, but we're a limited number of volunteers, so it's  possible this won't be addressed swiftly.

If you need any help, or just have general Babel or JavaScript questions, we have a  vibrant [Slack community](https://babeljs.slack.com) that typically always has someone  willing to help. You can sign-up [here](https://slack.babeljs.io/) for an invite."

Good catch! This needs to be fixed in this list: https://github.com/babel/babel/blob/bfcf783834cbe293ca540e84c1ad285ed2e728e2/packages/babel-types/src/definitions/core.ts#L2067

I'm assigning this bug to you since you ticked "I would like to work on a fix"; feel free to ask if you need any help!

@nicolo-ribaudo I'm wanting to make a test that scans all the `@babel/parser` output fixtures, and checks to see if any AST nodes in those have fields that are missing from the `@babel/types` defs, so that we can catch missing fields like this going forward.

But I doubt it's appropriate to have tests from `@babel/types` depend on content in `@babel/parser`.  Is there any other way to make such a test that you can think of?  I'm basically wishing to get an exhaustive list of all the fields `@babel/parser` can produce.  Perhaps I could run this test in `@babel/parser` instead?
Oh well, I think it's ok to put it in `babel-types`'s tests

Are `declare`, `readonly`, and `definite` all valid `ClassPrivateProperty` fields as well?  (#13563) If so than I can fix both these issues by spreading all of these fields into `ClassProperty` and `ClassPrivateProperty`.

Though I'm still confused why it was necessary to make a separate `ClassPrivateProperty` node type instead of just allowing `ClassProperty.key` to be a `PrivateName`...

- `StaticBlock.static` looks like a parser bug.
- `ImportDeclaration.attributes` has been replaced by `ImportDeclaration.assertions`, and it will be removed in Babel 8
- `ClassPrivateProperty.decalre` and `ClassPrivateProperty.optional` should be disallowed by the parser.

All the other ones look like valid AST props when parsing Flow/TS.

> Though I'm still confused why it was necessary to make a separate ClassPrivateProperty node type instead of just allowing ClassProperty.key to be a PrivateName...

Because existing plugins relied on the assumption that `ClassProperty`'s key is either computed or a string/identifier, and we couldn't break that assumption when introducing private properties.

I see, so adding to the set of types a single-value field can be would be considered breaking, but adding to the set of types an array field like `ClassBody.body` can take isn't considered breaking?  Is there a consistent philosophy or do you decide on a case-by-case basis?

issue.title: add 12 missing NODE_FIELDS

repository.name: babel
repository.description: Babel is a compiler for writing next generation JavaScript.

issue.body: fix #13558 fix #13563 QUESTION: Can `ExportDefaultDeclaration.exportKind` be anything other than `"value"`? I looked through the parser code and tried to come up with Flow or TS example that would result in `exportKind: "type"`, but couldn't find any. | Q | A | ------------------------ | --- | Fixed Issues? | `Fixes #1, Fixes #2` | Patch: Bug Fix? | Yes | Major: Breaking Change? | No | Minor: New Feature? | No | Tests Added + Pass? | Yes | Documentation PR Link | | Any Dependency Changes? | Added `glob` and `fs-extra` to `devDependencies` of `@babel/types` | License | MIT
